meanings.definition: To move slowly and quietly in a way that may seem unnatural or frightening.
meanings.sent1: The spider creeped across the floor, making me jump.
meanings.sent2: The ghost creeped up the stairs, scaring everyone in the house.
meanings.sent3: I creeped up behind my friend and shouted 'Boo!'
meanings.sent4: The fog creeped in, enveloping the town in a mysterious haze.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of the tree creeped along the wall, creating eerie shapes.

meanings.definition: To cause a feeling of fear or unease.
meanings.sent1: The horror movie really creeped me out.
meanings.sent2: The strange noise outside the window creeped her.
meanings.sent3: The creepy doll in the attic always creeped me out as a child.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley behind the house always creeped him whenever he passed by.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house on the hillside always creeped out the neighborhood kids.

meanings.definition: To have a feeling of fear or unease.
meanings.sent1: She creeped at the thought of walking through the dark forest alone.
meanings.sent2: He creeped whenever he heard footsteps behind him.
meanings.sent3: The eerie silence of the graveyard creeped them out.
meanings.sent4: The strange figure in the distance creeped her as she walked home.
meanings.sent5: The old, creaky house always creeped him out at night.
